title: Drawing, "Organ"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle; an enriched variation of 1901-39-2784. The main difference consists in the entablature above the compartments being in the same height, and a conch above the central one. The lateral frames of teh central compartment are pillars with separate pillar strips. Those like the outer pillars have heads in place of capitals but no pnale frames in the pedestals. In front of the pipes are in central compartment a trophy of musical instruments with scrolls and festoons, in the lateral ones a variation of the corresponding motif in 1901-39-2784, without festoons.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource
